subject: Re: [junit] Future of testing tools
msgSnippet: ... It s also why static methods are much easier to keep disorganized. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide to software craftsmanship
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 2/20/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...
> <mailto:jbrains762%40gmail.com>> wrote:
>
> > I find it easier to deal with
> > dependencies through objects than global methods.
>
> Really?
>
> Yet, static methods have one less dependency than instance methods
> (they don't depend on 'this' to run correctly), which is why static
> methods are usually easier to move around than instance ones.

It's also why static methods are much easier to keep disorganized.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
